description: From Middle English adieu also adew, adewe, adue, from Old French adieu (“to God”), a shortening of a Dieu vous comant (“I commend you to God”), from Medieval Latin ad Deum (“to God”). Doublet of adios.

entries.meaning: A farewell, a goodbye; especially a fond farewell, or a lasting or permanent farewell.
examples: We bid our final adieus to our family, then boarded the ship, bound for America.
